snippet: As Afghan forces reported progress in retaking Kunduz from the Taliban, the top American general in Afghanistan admitted that the initial military report on the strike was wrong.
abstract: Gen John F Campbell, American commander in Afghanistan, says Afghan forces asked for airstrike against Taliban in Kunduz that destroyed Doctors Without Borders hospital there, killing 22 people; uncertainty continues over who actually called for strike and whether any of the Afghan or American troops involved knew they were unleashing a sustained air attack on a hospital.

byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As Afghan forces reported progress in retaking Kunduz from the Taliban, the top American general in Afghanistan admitted that the initial military report on the strike was wrong.

headline.main: U.S. General Says Afghans Requested Airstrike That Hit Kunduz Hospital
headline.print_headline: U.S. General Says Afghans Requested Airstrike

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
